headline.sub: This Self-Taught Boxer Has Her Eye on the Olympics

docs.snippet: Alex Love, a self-taught boxer from Monroe, Wash., will compete in the U.S. Olympic Team Trials in February for a shot at the London Games....

byline.original: Sue Jaye Johnson and Erik Olsen

docs.lead_paragraph: Alex Love, a self-taught boxer from Monroe, Wash., will compete in the U.S. Olympic Team Trials in February for a shot at the London Games.

docs.abstract: The cast and crew of the Luxury Collection Hotels and Resorts's short film "Here," divulged their check-in dos and don'ts.

docs.snippet: The cast and crew of the Luxury Collection Hotels and Resorts's short film "Here," divulged their check-in dos and don'ts....
docs.abstract: The cast and crew of the Luxury Collection Hotels and Resorts's short film "Here," divulged their check-in dos and don'ts.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last night, the screening room of the Core Club in midtown Manhattan was packed with fashion, art and media insiders grazing on caviar and popcorn. The snacks were for the screening of the Luxury Collection Hotels and Resorts's short film "Here," starring Agyness Deyn, who looked especially fresh faced ("It was all Chanel," said the makeup artist Nico Guilis) and wore a shimmering Marc Jacobs look complete with the metallic kitten heels and fringed clutch.

headline.main: Luminaries Gather Virtually to Mark Global Fund's 10th Anniversary

docs.snippet: It has been ten years since the good and the great came together to create the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria. Many of them will feature in a new short film, and Bill Gates is expected to make an announcement connected to the ...
docs.abstract: It has been ten years since the good and the great came together to create the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria. Many of them will feature in a new short film, and Bill Gates is expected to make an announcement connected to the anniversary at his news conference Thursday morning.

headline.main: Luminaries Gather Virtually to Mark Global Fund's 10th Anniversary

docs.snippet: It has been ten years since the good and the great came together to create the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria. Many of them will feature in a new short film, and Bill Gates is expected to make an announcement connected to the ...

keywords.value: Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: It has been ten years since the good and the great came together to create the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria. Many of them will feature in a new short film, and Bill Gates is expected to make an announcement connected to the anniversary at his news conference Thursday morning.
docs.lead_paragraph: DAVOS, Switzerland - One place where Davos luminaries will be gathering this year - at least virtually - is on the silver screen. To mark the 10th anniversary of the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria, Fund supporters including Bill Gates, Bono, Tony Blair, Bill Clinton and Jeffrey Sachs will feature in a two-minute film that celebrates the Fund's work, while calling for more efforts against the diseases that still kill millions of poor people.

docs.abstract: The writer-director of “Margin Call,” who was nominated for his screenplay, had quit filmmaking after a previous project fell apart.

headline.main: A Few Tears on Oscar-Nod Morning

docs.snippet: The writer-director of "Margin Call," who was nominated for his screenplay, had quit filmmaking after a previous project fell apart. He was so superstitious about the new film working out that he didn't tell his wife about it until he was getting ...
docs.abstract: The writer-director of "Margin Call," who was nominated for his screenplay, had quit filmmaking after a previous project fell apart. He was so superstitious about the new film working out that he didn't tell his wife about it until he was getting ready to shoot.
docs.lead_paragraph: Like a producer of "Midnight in Paris," the writer-director of the financial thriller "Margin Call," J.C. Chandor, who received his first Oscar nomination on Tuesday for best original screenplay, also initially worried about finding an audience. "Our film has always suffered from the fact that it doesn't sound that good on paper," he said. "It's not the most heartwarming, feel-good movie."

docs.abstract: Chris Christie says he wants voters to decide on gay marriage. That's a punt, to say the least.

headline.main: Marriage Equality: Demagoguery in New Jersey

docs.snippet: Chris Christie says he wants voters to decide on gay marriage. That's a punt, to say the least....

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Chris Christie says he wants voters to decide on gay marriage. That's a punt, to say the least.
docs.lead_paragraph: To borrow an old Washington joke about another self-promoting politician, the most dangerous place in politics is between Chris Christie and a TV crew. Most weeks, he clamors for national attention with rhetoric about small government (for the poor, that is, not the rich). This week, he's taken up gay marriage.

headline.main: New Books for the Old Internet

docs.snippet: There have been many attempts to replicate the experience of reading a real, tangible book on a screen. There is Google Books, of course, and this somewhat unconvincing page-flipping simulation. There is also Project Gutenberg, the vast online arc...
docs.abstract: There have been many attempts to replicate the experience of reading a real, tangible book on a screen. There is Google Books, of course, and this somewhat unconvincing page-flipping simulation. There is also Project Gutenberg, the vast online archive of public domain e-books, and, you know, the Kindle. But here's the best version I've seen.
